snippet: The city comptroller, Scott M. Stringer, is issuing a directive that he says will standardize how information technology contracts are handled across all city agencies.
abstract: New York City Comptroller Scott M Stringer is issuing directive that he says will standardize how information technology contracts are handled across all city agencies; city has been burned for years by boondoggles, fraud and delays in its biggest computerization contracts, and new plan will put in place measures that could improve oversight and keep projects from spiraling out of control.
lead_paragraph: The city comptroller, Scott M. Stringer, is issuing a directive that he says will standardize how information technology contracts are handled across all city agencies.

headline.main: Stringer to Increase Oversight of New York City’s Computerization Contracts
headline.print_headline: City Comptroller Offers Plan to Streamline Information Technology Contracts
